gov.nih.nci.ncicb.webtree
Class WebTree

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--gov.nih.nci.ncicb.webtree.WebTree
public abstract class WebTree
extends java.lang.Object

WebTree is the abstact base class for implementation of a web based GUI tree navigator. This class encapsulates all functionality necessary to build web trees that are processed by the WebTreeMain.jsp.

How to implement:

Create a subclass extending this class implementing the getTree(Hashtable params) method. This is the only REQUIRED method to implement, others are optional to gain further functionality. You must create a tree structure using the DefaultMutableTreeNode swing component consisting of WebNode objects.

Optionally you can implement the getSynonyms(String term) method to add the functionality of a synonym search executed during the tree search. Give the search term entered by the user, a Vector of additional search terms to search the tree for should be returned.

Optionally you can implement the getPostSearchMsg() method. This method is called after a search is performed, and should return a string containing information you may feel is useful to communicate to the user. It is displayed at the end of the search results list.

How to execute:

The WebTreeMain.jsp is the primary jsp that will process the tree for GUI display. It requires one parameters at a minimum. The 'treeClass' parameter which should point to your derived class. The jsp will then invoke the getTree(Hashtable params) you have implemented to retrieve the tree structure. Using the 'treeParams' parameter in the jsp allows you to send your getTree method parameters for your internal use. The 'treeParams' parameter should contain a string of parameters in the format of "key1:value1;key2:value2;key3:value3" etc.. These parameters will be represented in the Hashtable that is passed into the getTree(Hashtable params) method you implement.

Created on 09/26/2002

Version:
1.0
Author:
Marc Piparo SAIC

Method Detail

getTree

public abstract javax.swing.tree.DefaultMutableTreeNode getTree(java.util.Hashtable params)
                                                         throws java.lang.Exception
Builds and returns a tree structure of defaultMutableTreeNodes using WebNode objects.

Parameters:
params - the parameters supplied to the WebTreeMain.jsp 'treeParams' parameter using the "key1:value1;key2:value2;key3:value3" syntax.
Returns:
The DefaultMutableTreeNode representing the root node of the tree.

getSynonyms

public java.util.Vector getSynonyms(java.lang.String term)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
If implemented should return a Vector of similar terms or synonyms given the term parameter supplied. Used during the search tree process initiated in the GUI.

Parameters:
term - the search term to retrieve synonyms for.
Returns:
A Vector of terms representing synonyms for the search term supplied.

getPostSearchMsg

public java.lang.String getPostSearchMsg()
If implemented should build a string message which may contain HTML displayed after a search has been performed. It is displayed at the end of the search results listing.

Returns:
A string containing a message which may contain HTML tags.

setSkin

public void setSkin(java.lang.String skin)
Sets the current skin name.

Parameters:
skin - A string which corresponds to a directory name in the webtree/skins directory.

getSkin

public java.lang.String getSkin()
Returns the current skin name

Returns:
A string containing the name of the current skin corresponding to the directory name in the webtree/skins directory.
